59 class ProcGrid {
60  public:
61  typedef uint_fast32_t size_type;
62 
63  private:
64  World* world_;
65  size_type rows_;
66  size_type cols_;
67  size_type size_;
68  size_type proc_rows_;
69  size_type proc_cols_;
70  size_type
71  proc_size_;
72  ProcessID rank_row_;
74  ProcessID rank_col_;
75  size_type local_rows_;
76  size_type local_cols_;
77  size_type local_size_;
78 
80 
87  static size_type optimal_proc_row(const double nprocs, const double Mm,
88  const double Nn) {
89  // Compute the initial guess for P_row. This is the optimal guess when
90  // Mm is equal to Nn, and the ideal solution.
91  double P_row_estimate = std::sqrt(nprocs);
92 
93  // Here we want to find the positive, real root of the polynomial:
94  // Nn(2x^4 - x^3) + Mm(Px - 2P^2) = 0
95  // using a Newton-Raphson algorithm.
96 
97  // Precompute some constants
98  const double PMm = nprocs * Mm;
99  const double two_P = nprocs + nprocs;
100 
101  const unsigned int max_it = 21u;
102  unsigned int it = 0u;
103  double r = 0.0;
104  do {
105  // Precompute P_row squared
106  const double P_row2 = P_row_estimate * P_row_estimate;
107  const double NnP_row2 = Nn * P_row2;
108 
109  // Compute the value of f(P_row_estimate) and df(P_row_estimate)
110  const double f = NnP_row2 * (2.0 * P_row2 - P_row_estimate) +
111  PMm * (P_row_estimate - two_P);
112  const double df = NnP_row2 * (8.0 * P_row_estimate - 3.0) + PMm;
113 
114  // Compute a new guess for P_row
115  const double P_row_n1 = P_row_estimate - (f / df);
116 
117  // Compute the residual for this iteration
118  r = std::abs(P_row_n1 - P_row_estimate);
119 
120  // Update the guess
121  P_row_estimate = P_row_n1;
122 
123  } while ((r > 0.1) && ((++it) < max_it));
124 
125  return P_row_estimate + 0.5;
126  }
127 
129 
140  void minimize_unused_procs(size_type& x, size_type& y, const size_type nprocs,
141  const size_type min_x, const size_type max_x) {
142  // Check for the quick exit
143  size_type unused = x * y;
144  if (unused == 0u) return;
145 
146  // Compute the range of values for x to be tested.
147  const size_type delta = std::max<size_type>(1ul, std::log2(nprocs));
148 
149  const size_type optimal_x = x;
150  size_type diff = 0ul;
151  const size_type min_test_x =
152  std::max<int_fast32_t>(min_x, int_fast32_t(x) - delta);
153  size_type test_x = std::min(x + delta, max_x);
154 
155  for (; test_x >= min_test_x; --test_x) {
156  const size_type test_y = nprocs / test_x;
157  const size_type test_unused = nprocs - test_x * test_y;
158  const size_type test_diff = std::abs(long(optimal_x) - long(test_x));
159 
160  if ((test_unused < unused) ||
161  ((test_unused == unused) && (test_diff < diff))) {
162  x = test_x;
163  y = test_y;
164  unused = test_unused;
165  diff = test_diff;
166  }
167  }
168  }
169 
171 
174  void init(const size_type rank, const size_type nprocs,
175  const std::size_t row_size, const std::size_t col_size) {
176  // Check for the simple cases first ...
177  if (nprocs == 1u) { // Only one process
178 
179  // Set process grid sizes
180  proc_rows_ = 1u;
181  proc_cols_ = 1u;
182  proc_size_ = 1u;
183 
184  // Set this process rank
185  rank_row_ = 0;
186  rank_col_ = 0;
187 
188  // Set local counts
189  local_rows_ = rows_;
190  local_cols_ = cols_;
191  local_size_ = size_;
192 
193  } else if (size_ <= nprocs) { // Max one tile per process
194 
195  // Set process grid sizes
196  proc_rows_ = rows_;
197  proc_cols_ = cols_;
198  proc_size_ = size_;
199 
200  if (rank < proc_size_) {
201  // Set this process rank
202  rank_row_ = rank / proc_cols_;
203  rank_col_ = rank % proc_cols_;
204 
205  // Set local counts
206  local_rows_ = 1u;
207  local_cols_ = 1u;
208  local_size_ = 1u;
209  }
210 
211  } else { // The not so simple case
212 
213  // Compute the limits for process rows
214  const size_type min_proc_rows =
215  std::max<size_type>(((nprocs + cols_ - 1ul) / cols_), 1ul);
216  const size_type max_proc_rows = std::min<size_type>(nprocs, rows_);
217 
218  // Compute optimal the number of process rows and columns in terms of
219  // communication time.
220  proc_rows_ = std::max<size_type>(
221  min_proc_rows,
222  std::min<size_type>(optimal_proc_row(nprocs, row_size, col_size),
223  max_proc_rows));
224  proc_cols_ = nprocs / proc_rows_;
225 
226  if ((proc_rows_ > min_proc_rows) && (proc_rows_ < max_proc_rows)) {
227  // Search for the values of proc_rows_ and proc_cols_ that minimizes
228  // the number of unused processes in the process grid.
229  minimize_unused_procs(proc_rows_, proc_cols_, nprocs, min_proc_rows,
230  max_proc_rows);
231  }
232 
233  proc_size_ = proc_rows_ * proc_cols_;
234 
235  if (rank < proc_size_) {
236  // Set this process rank
237  rank_row_ = rank / proc_cols_;
238  rank_col_ = rank % proc_cols_;
239 
240  // Set local counts
241  local_rows_ = (rows_ / proc_rows_) +
242  (size_type(rank_row_) < (rows_ % proc_rows_) ? 1u : 0u);
243  local_cols_ = (cols_ / proc_cols_) +
244  (size_type(rank_col_) < (cols_ % proc_cols_) ? 1u : 0u);
245  local_size_ = local_rows_ * local_cols_;
246  }
247  }
248  }
249 
250  public:

254  ProcGrid()
255  : world_(NULL),
256  rows_(0u),
257  cols_(0u),
258  size_(0u),
259  proc_rows_(0u),
260  proc_cols_(0u),
261  proc_size_(0u),
262  rank_row_(0),
263  rank_col_(0),
264  local_rows_(0u),
265  local_cols_(0u),
266  local_size_(0u) {}
267 
269 
270  // This constructor makes a rough estimate of the optimal process
271  // dimensions. The goal is for the ratios of proc_rows/proc_cols and
272  // rows/cols to be approximately equal.
278  ProcGrid(World& world, const size_type rows, const size_type cols,
279  const std::size_t row_size, const std::size_t col_size)
280  : world_(&world),
281  rows_(rows),
282  cols_(cols),
283  size_(rows_ * cols_),
284  proc_rows_(0ul),
285  proc_cols_(0ul),
286  proc_size_(0ul),
287  rank_row_(-1),
288  rank_col_(-1),
289  local_rows_(0ul),
290  local_cols_(0ul),
291  local_size_(0ul) {
292  // Check for non-zero sizes
293  TA_ASSERT(rows_ >= 1u);
294  TA_ASSERT(cols_ >= 1u);
295  TA_ASSERT(row_size >= 1ul);
296  TA_ASSERT(col_size >= 1ul);
297 
298  init(world_->rank(), world_->size(), row_size, col_size);
299  }
300 
301 #ifdef TILEDARRAY_ENABLE_TEST_PROC_GRID
302  // Note: The following function is here for testing purposes only. It
303  // has the same functionality as the default constructor above, except the
304  // rank and number of processes can be specified.
305 
307 
308  // This constructor makes a rough estimate of the optimal process
309  // dimensions. The goal is for the ratios of proc_rows/proc_cols and
310  // rows/cols to be approximately equal.
318  ProcGrid(World& world, const size_type test_rank, size_type test_nprocs,
319  const size_type rows, const size_type cols,
320  const std::size_t row_size, const std::size_t col_size)
321  : world_(&world),
322  rows_(rows),
323  cols_(cols),
324  size_(rows_ * cols_),
325  proc_rows_(0u),
326  proc_cols_(0u),
327  proc_size_(0u),
328  rank_row_(-1),
329  rank_col_(-1),
330  local_rows_(0u),
331  local_cols_(0u),
332  local_size_(0u) {
333  // Check for non-zero sizes
334  TA_ASSERT(rows >= 1u);
335  TA_ASSERT(cols >= 1u);
336  TA_ASSERT(row_size >= 1u);
337  TA_ASSERT(col_size >= 1u);
338  TA_ASSERT(test_rank < test_nprocs);
339 
340  init(test_rank, test_nprocs, row_size, col_size);
341  }
342 #endif // TILEDARRAY_ENABLE_TEST_PROC_GRID

379  local_size_ = other.local_size_;
380 
381  return *this;

444  madness::Group make_row_group(const madness::DistributedID& did) const {
445  TA_ASSERT(world_);
446 
447  madness::Group group;
448 
449  if (local_size_ != 0u) {
450  // Construct a vector to hold the
451  std::vector<ProcessID> proc_list;
452  proc_list.reserve(proc_cols_);
453 
454  // Populate the row process list
455  size_type p = rank_row_ * proc_cols_;
456  const size_type row_end = p + proc_cols_;
457  for (; p < row_end; ++p) proc_list.push_back(p);
458 
459  // Construct the group
460  group = madness::Group(*world_, proc_list, did);
461  }
462 
463  return group;
464  }
465 
467 
470  madness::Group make_col_group(const madness::DistributedID& did) const {
471  TA_ASSERT(world_);
472 
473  madness::Group group;
474 
475  if (local_size_ != 0u) {
476  // Generate the list of processes in rank_row
477  std::vector<ProcessID> proc_list;
478  proc_list.reserve(proc_rows_);
479 
480  // Populate the column process list
481  for (size_type p = rank_col_; p < proc_size_; p += proc_cols_)
482  proc_list.push_back(p);
483 
484  // Construct the group
485  if (proc_list.size() != 0)
486  group = madness::Group(*world_, proc_list, did);
487  }
488 
489  return group;
490  }
491 
493 
497  ProcessID map_row(const size_type row) const {
498  TA_ASSERT(row < proc_rows_);
499  return rank_col_ + row * proc_cols_;
500  }
501 
503 
507  ProcessID map_col(const size_type col) const {
508  TA_ASSERT(col < proc_cols_);
509  return rank_row_ * proc_cols_ + col;
510  }
511 
513 
516  std::shared_ptr<Pmap> make_pmap() const {
517  TA_ASSERT(world_);
518 
519  return std::make_shared<CyclicPmap>(*world_, rows_, cols_, proc_rows_,
520  proc_cols_);
521  }
522 
524 
529  std::shared_ptr<Pmap> make_col_phase_pmap(const size_type rows) const {
530  TA_ASSERT(world_);
531 
532  return std::make_shared<CyclicPmap>(*world_, rows, cols_, proc_rows_,
533  proc_cols_);
534  }
535 
537 
542  std::shared_ptr<Pmap> make_row_phase_pmap(const size_type cols) const {
543  TA_ASSERT(world_);
544 
545  return std::make_shared<CyclicPmap>(*world_, rows_, cols, proc_rows_,
546  proc_cols_);
547  }
